basics.name: Patrick El-Azem
basics.label: Cloud Architecture, Software Development, Applied AI and Analytics, Data Engineering, DevOps/Automation and Cybersecurity
basics.summary:
About Me 
 Experienced, personable hands-on technologist focused on rapid, pragmatic, iterative delivery. Multi-certified Azure expert. 
 Cloud Architecture, Software Development, Applied AI and Analytics, Data Engineering, DevOps/Automation and Cybersecurity. 
 Skilled technical seller, consultant, presenter. I listen, learn, create clarity, and help to deliver success. 
 Objective 
 Technical lead/delivery role in product/platform engineering and program management, technical sales, consulting. Hybrid or Remote. 
 Domains: cloud, architecture, data/applied AI, development/DevOps, integration/automation.

work.name: SES Satellites
work.position: Cloud Architect, DevOps Engineer, Data Engineer
work.summary: Azure architecture, DevOps engineering, infrastructure automation, .NET/Python development, API integrations, data engineering and cybersecurity compliance for cloud-native greenfield revenue optimization and yield management platforms.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Azure architecture and workload remediation for Azure Tenant Baseline NIST cybersecurity control implementations across organizational divisions. Built artifacts including assessment and remediation code, architectures and documentation. Escalated security concerns with engineering groups, trained technical teams, executed technical work and resolved advanced technical issues.

work.name: EPAM Systems
work.summary: Led Azure architecture and migration process design on financial-industry datacenter-to-Azure application migration projects.

work.name: Microsoft
work.position: Global Cloud Solution Architect | Customer Success
work.summary:
Technical lead for enterprise Azure client mission-critical projects. Led solution architecture, technical delivery and represented clients to product engineering groups. Led solution development, technical training, hackathons, and executive briefings. 
 Cloud Solution Architect in Global, National, Regional and Financial Services Industry roles. Member of Azure Mission-Critical team that created reference architectures and deploy-ready deliverables published to Microsoft Learn. Selected for Senior Technical Leadership Program and Quest Engineering Rotation. 
 Notable successes included retail store floor map flow and dwell analysis using store video and Azure Cognitive Services, which led to significant Azure commitment; high-volume financial document analytics; infosec-driven compute refresh automation in highly complex financial industry context; multiple competitive cloud wins; more. 
 Program Manager with Azure Cosmos DB engineering group. Delivered deploy-ready sample applications and contributed to product documentation and code libraries.

work.name: 4D Technologies CADLearning
work.summary: Led zero-downtime migration of customer platforms to AWS. Modernized digital content creation platforms, analytics and reporting, and built partner integration APIs. Built technology team and roadmap. Created operations and support capabilities resulting in ongoing customer satisfaction ratings > 99% and systems uptime > 99.9%.

work.name: Net Gain Solutions
work.summary: Technical project engagements including client/API .NET/C# development, DevOps, data engineering and design, BI and analytics, off-the-shelf system implementations. Clients included Fidelity Investments, Horizon Beverage Company, C&J Bus Lines, Borealis Ventures, Nexamp, American Health Centers, Liberty International, Override, Middle East Bakery.

work.name: Global Relief Technologies
work.summary: Led development team that delivered supply chain performance management applications for US DoD force protection systems deployed in combat theaters.

work.name: Message Secure Corporation
work.summary: Created IT Operations and Compliance teams at financial-industry technology provider. Led successful response to federal (FDIC, FFIEC) examinations. Initiated COBIT IT control framework implementation for SAS 70 certification process.

work.name: Trade Wings Inc.
work.summary: Built web-based supply chain and procurement platform. Co-created supply chain optimization algorithms which yielded double-digit % cost savings for manufacturing customers. Team member for successful ISO 9001:2000 certification.

work.name: Furniture.com
work.summary: Built leading B2C e-commerce site. Staffed and led web development team.

work.name: Deloitte & Touche / DRT Systems
work.summary: Member of development team that built Liberty Mutual Insurance’s first Java and web insurance claims processing platform.

work.name: David Bowie
work.summary: Built pop star’s first B2C web site, bowieart.com, whose success validated later Bowie online investments. Implemented online purchasing and payment processing.

work.name: Artificial Life
work.summary: Managed organization and client infrastructure, operations, and web sites.

work.name: TRC Environmental Corporation
work.summary: Performed Clean Air Act plant audits, permitting, plume impact analysis, and compliance for clients including General Motors. Built first company web site.

volunteer.summary:
Founded non-profit to teach business technology skills to asylum seeker refugees who have been resettled to New Hampshire, with goal of helping members of underserved communities gain basic employment skills.

Designed course curricula and examinations. Worked with interpreters to teach classes to non-English speakers. Procured equipment. Issued certificates to students who finished courses and passed final exams.

awards.title: FY16 Circle of Excellence Top Subsidiary
FY16 Q1 Cloud & Enterprise Hero: Customer Obsession

certificates.name: Please see LinkedIn profile for full list

references.name: Joseph Ibarra, PMP
references.reference:
Patrick worked for me as a contractor at Microsoft for slightly over 1 year. His core responsibility was providing internal employees across the company with remediation support to improve the security of their Azure subscriptions. I can recall my first interaction with Patrick – it was to determine if he was a good fit for the role. He was very well prepared, precise and calculated, and amazed me. It was a no-brainer to bring him on and it was like finding a diamond in the rough. Patrick would go on to amaze me throughout his engagement. 

Here are 3 things that stood out about Patrick:
1.	Technical Excellence: Patrick really knows his stuff, especially Azure. He is the type to dig in, reproduce an issue for his own learning and to put himself in the shoes of the customer. He is naturally the type that likes to learn by doing. He thinks outside the box on how to solve different technical challenges.
2.	Contributions to the Success of Others: Patrick is a nature born leader. He is not only a great employee, but a peer to his co-workers. He volunteers to help them and is genuinely interested in helping them learn and grow. For example, Patrick put together a set of PowerShell scripts to make his job easier and documented his learnings throughout his engagement in a OneNote. He shared these with his peers (even though nobody asked him to) and these resources are now used as onboarding guides for new hires. Often times, his peers will come to him for help and he is always willing to partner.
3.	Excellent Communications and Customer Service Skills: One of Patrick’s biggest strengths is his ability to explain the most complex technical issue to a non-technical person. This makes him very versatile in being able to influence a diverse range of audience from senior management to hardcore engineers. I never hesitated to bring Patrick into a meeting with senior leadership as he intuitively knew at what altitude to keep the conversation. Customers raved about working with Patrick and his outstanding customer service – he was a key reason why we were able to achieve an all time high customer satisfaction score. Finally, Patrick is accountable for what he says and does. I never had to follow-up with him. He was great at managing up, setting expectations, and always exceeded my expectations.

Thank you Patrick for helping to make Microsoft more secure. I hope we get to work together again really soon!

references.name: Ayman El-Ghazali
references.reference: Patrick has been an amazing colleague, mentor, and friend to me over the last few years at Microsoft.  His passion for excellence is contagious.  His knowledge depth and breadth sets him apart from many people that I have meet throughout my career.  If he doesn't know the answer he will find it! He's a great motivator and a great listener.  More importantly than all this he is very genuine and authentic at the highest levels of professionalism.  You know that you are dealing with someone that has a deep concern for truth and doing what is right in all aspects of life and helping others achieve their best.  El-Azem means "The Great" and Patrick truly is one of the greatest people that I've crossed paths with.  Thank you for your leadership and your guidance!

references.name: Richard Weeks
references.reference: Patrick is a very rare commodity in the software engineering world. He combines outstanding technical prowess in his software engineering abilities coupled with drive and intelligence in team leadership skills that in my 30+ years as a software contractor I have rarely seen matched. I have had the pleasure of working with him at both 4D technologies and at Global Relief Technologies. Your organization can only benefit by bringing him on board.

references.name: Cheri Reed
references.reference: I worked with Patrick at 4D Technologies and he was an amazing leader!  His technical expertise was unlike any other I have experienced.  A true leader!  He managed projects with clear, definitive and realistic tasks.   It was a pleasure working with him.

references.name: June Denis
references.reference: I've worked with Patrick at GRT and 4D Technologies. His attention to detail and knowledge in software project management gives everyone a clear sense of direction and responsibility. Patrick is an adept problem solver and one of the most organized, concise thinkers I have ever had the pleasure of working with.

references.name: Chuda Niroula
references.reference:
Hi patrick,
It was my pleasure that first you were my teacher and a friend. I enjoyed and learnt a lot of things during the session we worked to teach advanced computer to youth of our community. hopefully i'm expecting to continue advanced computer course to Bhutanese youth which will help them further.

I on my behalf and and on behalf of Bhutanese community of NH would like to thank you for your hard work as a advanced computer Instructor.Your small contribution helps Bhutanese folks in their daily life specially who got opportunity complete their course.

Thsnk you for your support and contribution.

references.name: AnnMarie Nolin
references.reference: AHCI hired Patrick as an IT Consultant to help me sort through a server upgrade program. Patrick's concised, detailed questions not only guided me through the necessary terrain I was unfamiliar with, but allowed me to gain knowledge of the IT world that I never expected. We are very pleased with the guidance Patrick provided and are even more pleased with the option we chose with Patrick's help.

references.name: Bonnie Jean Butler
references.reference:
Patrick is a great leader of technology teams, understands sophisticated technical barriers and strives for technological breakthroughs.  He continues to demonstrate a high level of technical expertise and recognizes the value of technical team dynamics. He ROCKS! 

Dr. BonnieJean Butler, President
Butler Global Consulting

references.name: Jamie Lesniak
references.reference: Affordable IT solutions for all size companies!  Patrick help C&J accomplish our needs as well as worked as a liason between other IT company dealings.  Trustworthy, and upfront in all aspects.

references.name: Sebastien Aube
references.reference: Patrick has the experience and ability to achieve success in most if not all software projects. I would definitely work with him again.
